message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.DC 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with network utility maximization in wireless mesh networks, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The use of Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio (SINR) as the interference model and joint rate control, traffic splitting, routing, scheduling, link rate allocation and power control to formulate the network utility maximization problem involves information theory concepts. 
3. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper deals with multiple gateways wireless mesh networks, which can be considered as a type of social and information network. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper mentions the generation rate of traffic flows, which can be related to multimedia traffic. 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The proposed Joint dynamic Gateway selection, link Rate allocation and Power control (JGRP) algorithm involves distributed and parallel computing for joint routing, scheduling, links rate allocation and node power allocation in each time slot.
